+(Î·+2â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2)â€‹Î³(1âˆ’Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)âŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2âŸ=(C).ğœ‚2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2ğ›¾1ğœŒğ’¯ğ’¯subscriptâŸsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2absentğ¶\displaystyle+\left(\eta+2\beta\eta^{2}\right)\frac{\gamma}{(1-\rho\mathcal{T})\mathcal{T}}\underbrace{\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}}}_{=(C)}\;. (16)

Focusing on (C)ğ¶(C), we can change the outer summation bounds as

âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)âŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2=âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ’1âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)âŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¤âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)âŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2.superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}}=\sum_{t=1}^{T-1}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}}\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}}\;. (17)

Now, we can bound the right-hand side using LemmaÂ C.8 with a=Ïâ€‹ğ’¯<1ğ‘ğœŒğ’¯1a=\rho\mathcal{T}<1 and xk=ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¥0subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜20x_{k}=\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}\geq 0 to get that

âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)âŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’¯â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯1âˆ’Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2.superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğ’¯ğœŒğ’¯1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\sum_{t=1}^{T}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}}\leq\mathcal{T}\frac{\rho\mathcal{T}}{1-\rho\mathcal{T}}\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}\;.

Plugging this bound back to Eq.Â (C.1) and using 1(1âˆ’Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)2â‰¤41superscript1ğœŒğ’¯24\frac{1}{(1-\rho\mathcal{T})^{2}}\leq 4 gives

ğ”¼â€‹[fâ€‹(wT)âˆ’fâ€‹(w0)]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤0\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[f(w_{T})-f(w_{0})] â‰¤(âˆ’Î·2+2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2)â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+(Î²â€‹Î·22+3â€‹Î±â€‹(Î²2â€‹Î·2+Î²3â€‹Î·2))â€‹Tâ€‹Ïƒ~S2absentğœ‚22ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚223ğ›¼superscriptğ›½2ğœ‚2superscriptğ›½3superscriptğœ‚2ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq\left(-\frac{\eta}{2}+2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}\right)\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}+\left(\frac{\beta\eta^{2}}{2}+3\alpha\left(\frac{\beta^{2}\eta}{2}+\beta^{3}\eta^{2}\right)\right)T\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}
+(Î·+2â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2)â€‹Î³â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯(1âˆ’Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)2â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2ğœ‚2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2ğ›¾ğœŒğ’¯superscript1ğœŒğ’¯2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\quad+\left(\eta+2\beta\eta^{2}\right)\frac{\gamma\rho\mathcal{T}}{(1-\rho\mathcal{T})^{2}}\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}
â‰¤(âˆ’Î·2+2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+4â€‹Î³â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹(Î·+2â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2))â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2absentğœ‚22ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚24ğ›¾ğœŒğ’¯ğœ‚2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\left(-\frac{\eta}{2}+2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+4\gamma\rho\mathcal{T}\left(\eta+2\beta\eta^{2}\right)\right)\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}
+(Î²â€‹Î·22+3â€‹Î±â€‹Î²22â€‹(Î·+2â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2))â€‹Tâ€‹Ïƒ~S2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚223ğ›¼superscriptğ›½22ğœ‚2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\displaystyle\quad+\left(\frac{\beta\eta^{2}}{2}+\frac{3\alpha\beta^{2}}{2}\left(\eta+2\beta\eta^{2}\right)\right)T\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}
â‰¤(âˆ’Î·2+2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+8â€‹Î³â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹Î·)â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+(Î²â€‹Î·22+3â€‹Î±â€‹Î²2â€‹Î·)â€‹Tâ€‹Ïƒ~S2,absentğœ‚22ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚28ğ›¾ğœŒğ’¯ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚223ğ›¼superscriptğ›½2ğœ‚ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq\left(-\frac{\eta}{2}+2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+8\gamma\rho\mathcal{T}\eta\right)\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}+\left(\frac{\beta\eta^{2}}{2}+3\alpha\beta^{2}\eta\right)T\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}\;,

where in the last inequality we used the fact that Î·â‰¤130â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸â‰¤130â€‹Î²ğœ‚130ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒ130ğ›½\eta\leq\frac{1}{30\gamma\beta\theta}\leq\frac{1}{30\beta} to bound 2â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2â‰¤Î·2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2ğœ‚2\beta\eta^{2}\leq\eta.

Substituting Î±ğ›¼\alpha and ÏğœŒ\rho, we obtain:

ğ”¼â€‹[fâ€‹(wT)âˆ’fâ€‹(w0)]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤0\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[f(w_{T})-f(w_{0})] â‰¤(âˆ’Î·2+2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+160â€‹Î³â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯2â€‹Î·3)â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2absentğœ‚22ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2160ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğ’¯2superscriptğœ‚3superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\left(-\frac{\eta}{2}+2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+160\gamma\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}^{2}\eta^{3}\right)\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}
+(Î²â€‹Î·22+12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Î·3)â€‹Tâ€‹Ïƒ~S2.ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2212superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscriptğœ‚3ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\displaystyle\quad+\left(\frac{\beta\eta^{2}}{2}+12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\eta^{3}\right)T\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}\;.

Since Î·â‰¤130â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸ğœ‚130ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒ\eta\leq\frac{1}{30\gamma\beta\theta}, we can bound the coefficient of âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}} using LemmaÂ C.9. We get:

ğ”¼â€‹[fâ€‹(wT)âˆ’fâ€‹(w0)]â‰¤âˆ’Î·4â€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+(Î²â€‹Î·22+12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Î·3)â€‹Tâ€‹Ïƒ~S2.ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤0ğœ‚4superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2212superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscriptğœ‚3ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\mathbb{E}[f(w_{T})-f(w_{0})]\leq-\frac{\eta}{4}\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}+\left(\frac{\beta\eta^{2}}{2}+12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\eta^{3}\right)T\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}\;. (18)

Rearranging terms, multiplying by 4/Î·â€‹T4ğœ‚ğ‘‡4/\eta T, and plugging Ïƒ~S2=Ïƒ~2/Ssuperscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2superscript~ğœ2ğ‘†\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}=\tilde{\sigma}^{2}/S then gives

ğ”¼â€‹[1Tâ€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2]ğ”¼delimited-[]1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}\right] â‰¤4â€‹MÎ·â€‹T+2â€‹Î²â€‹Ïƒ~2Sâ€‹Î·+48â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~2Sâ€‹Î·2,absent4ğ‘€ğœ‚ğ‘‡2ğ›½superscript~ğœ2ğ‘†ğœ‚48superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscript~ğœ2ğ‘†superscriptğœ‚2\displaystyle\leq\frac{4M}{\eta T}+\frac{2\beta\tilde{\sigma}^{2}}{S}\eta+\frac{48\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}^{2}}{S}\eta^{2}\;,

where we also used ğ”¼â€‹[fâ€‹(w0)âˆ’fâ€‹(wT)]â‰¤fâ€‹(w0)âˆ’fâˆ—â‰¤Mğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤0ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤0superscriptğ‘“ğ‘€\mathbb{E}[f(w_{0})-f(w_{T})]\leq f(w_{0})-f^{*}\leq M. Applying LemmaÂ C.10 with our learning rate Î·ğœ‚\eta, we finally obtain:

ğ”¼â€‹[1Tâ€‹âˆ‘t=0Tâˆ’1âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2]â‰¤ğ”¼delimited-[]1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡0ğ‘‡1superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=0}^{T-1}{\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}}\right]\leq 4â€‹MTâ€‹(30â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸+Î²â€‹Ïƒ~2â€‹T2â€‹Mâ€‹S+(12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~2â€‹TMâ€‹S)1/3)+2â€‹Î²â€‹Ïƒ~2Sâ‹…2â€‹Mâ€‹SÎ²â€‹Ïƒ~2â€‹T4ğ‘€ğ‘‡30ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒğ›½superscript~ğœ2ğ‘‡2ğ‘€ğ‘†superscript12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscript~ğœ2ğ‘‡ğ‘€ğ‘†13â‹…2ğ›½superscript~ğœ2ğ‘†2ğ‘€ğ‘†ğ›½superscript~ğœ2ğ‘‡\displaystyle\frac{4M}{T}\left(30\gamma\beta\theta+\sqrt{\frac{\beta\tilde{\sigma}^{2}T}{2MS}}+\left(\frac{12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}^{2}T}{MS}\right)^{1/3}\right)+\frac{2\beta\tilde{\sigma}^{2}}{S}\cdot\sqrt{\frac{2MS}{\beta\tilde{\sigma}^{2}T}}
+48â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~2Sâ‹…(Mâ€‹S12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~2â€‹T)2/3â‹…48superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscript~ğœ2ğ‘†superscriptğ‘€ğ‘†12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscript~ğœ2ğ‘‡23\displaystyle+\frac{48\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}^{2}}{S}\cdot\left(\frac{MS}{12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}^{2}T}\right)^{2/3}
=\displaystyle= 4â€‹2â€‹Mâ€‹Î²â€‹Ïƒ~2Tâ€‹S+8â€‹(12â€‹M2â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~2)1/3T2/3â€‹S1/3+120â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸T,42ğ‘€ğ›½superscript~ğœ2ğ‘‡ğ‘†8superscript12superscriptğ‘€2superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2ğ’¯superscript~ğœ213superscriptğ‘‡23superscriptğ‘†13120ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒğ‘‡\displaystyle 4\sqrt{\frac{2M\beta\tilde{\sigma}^{2}}{TS}}+8\frac{(12M^{2}\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}^{2})^{1/3}}{T^{2/3}S^{1/3}}+\frac{120\gamma\beta\theta}{T}\;,

which concludes the proof.

âˆ

C.2 Technical Lemmata

In this section, we introduce some technical results used throughout our analysis. We start with the following lemma, yielding a bound on the second moment of the aggregated gradients that our PS uses to update its model.

Lemma C.1.

Consider the notations of 1. For every tâˆˆ[T]ğ‘¡delimited-[]ğ‘‡t\in\left[T\right], it holds that

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^tâˆ¥2â‰¤Ïƒ~S2+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î²2â‹…1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2.ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡2subscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†4ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2â‹…2superscriptğ›½21ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{t}\rVert^{2}\leq\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}+2\beta^{2}\cdot\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\;. (19)
Proof.

Since g^tsubscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡\hat{g}_{t} is an aggregation of local gradient, we can write,

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^tâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{t}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tg^tiâ€–2=ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®t(g^tiâˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)+âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti))â€–2absentğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘–2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–2\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\hat{g}_{t}^{i}}\right\|^{2}=\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\left(\hat{g}_{t}^{i}-\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})+\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})\right)}\right\|^{2}
=ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®t(g^tiâˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti))â€–2+ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)â€–2,absentğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–2\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\left(\hat{g}_{t}^{i}-\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})\right)}\right\|^{2}+\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})}\right\|^{2}\;,

where the last equality follows from AssumptionÂ 3.1 as ğ”¼â€‹[(g^tiâ€‹(w^ti)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti))âŠ¤â€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)]=0ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsuperscriptsubscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–topâˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–0\mathbb{E}[(\hat{g}_{t}^{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})-\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i}))^{\top}\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})]=0. Note that the first term in the right-hand side is the variance of the average of Sğ‘†S independent random variables with zero mean and variance bounded by Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}; therefore, it is bounded by Ïƒ2/Ssuperscriptğœ2ğ‘†\sigma^{2}/S. Thus, we get that

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^tâˆ¥2â‰¤Ïƒ2S+ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)â€–2.ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡2superscriptğœ2ğ‘†ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{t}\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{S}+\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})}\right\|^{2}\;. (20)

Focusing on the second term in the right-hand side, we have that

ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)â€–2â‰¤2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt))â€–2âŸ(A)+2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â€–2âŸ=(B),ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–2subscriptâŸ2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2ğ´subscriptâŸ2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2absentğµ\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})}\right\|^{2}\leq\underbrace{2\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\left(\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})-\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\right)}\right\|^{2}}_{(A)}+\underbrace{2\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})}\right\|^{2}}_{=(B)}\;, (21)

where we used the inequality âˆ¥a+bâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹âˆ¥aâˆ¥2+2â€‹âˆ¥bâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘2\lVert a+b\rVert^{2}\leq 2\lVert a\rVert^{2}+2\lVert b\rVert^{2}.

Bounding (A)ğ´(A):

Using LemmaÂ C.5 and the Î²ğ›½\beta-smoothness of the objective, we get that

2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt))â€–22ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle 2\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\left(\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})-\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\right)}\right\|^{2} â‰¤2Sâ€‹ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ¥âˆ‡fiâ€‹(w^ti)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2]absent2ğ‘†ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\frac{2}{S}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\hat{w}_{t}^{i})-\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\rVert^{2}}\right]
â‰¤2â€‹Î²2Sâ€‹ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2]absent2superscriptğ›½2ğ‘†ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\frac{2\beta^{2}}{S}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\right]
=2â€‹Î²2Sâ€‹ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2â‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t}]absent2superscriptğ›½2ğ‘†ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘â‹…superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\displaystyle=\frac{2\beta^{2}}{S}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}\right]
=2â€‹Î²2Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2,absent2superscriptğ›½2ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle=\frac{2\beta^{2}}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\;,

where the last equality follows from our assumption about the client participation process ğ’«â€‹(â‹…)ğ’«â‹…\mathcal{P}(\cdot), which guarantees that â„™â€‹(iâˆˆğ’®t)=S/Nâ„™ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ‘†ğ‘\mathbb{P}(i\in\mathcal{S}_{t})=S/N, independently of the optimization process.

Bounding (B)ğµ(B):

By the law of total expectation, (B)ğµ(B) can be written as follows,

2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â€–2=2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–âˆ‘i=1N(1Sâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t})â€–2=2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹[ğ”¼â€‹[â€–âˆ‘i=1N(1Sâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t})â€–2â€‹Â â€‹wt]].2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡22ğ”¼superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘â‹…1ğ‘†âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡22ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘â‹…1ğ‘†âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡2Â subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})}\right\|^{2}=2\mathbb{E}\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\left(\frac{1}{S}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}\right)}\right\|^{2}=2\mathbb{E}\left[\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\left(\frac{1}{S}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}\right)}\right\|^{2}~{}\vrule~{}w_{t}\right]\right]\;. (22)

Thus, we can use LemmaÂ C.3 with Xi=1Sâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t},iâˆˆ[N]formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–â‹…1ğ‘†âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘X_{i}=\frac{1}{S}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}},~{}i\in\left[N\right] to bound the inner expectation. Using â„™â€‹(iâˆˆğ’®t)=S/Nâ„™ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ‘†ğ‘\mathbb{P}(i\in\mathcal{S}_{t})=S/N, we have that

ğ”¼â€‹[Xi|wt]=1Sâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â‹…SN=1Nâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt),ğ”¼delimited-[]conditionalsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡â‹…1ğ‘†âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘†ğ‘1ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡\mathbb{E}[X_{i}|w_{t}]=\frac{1}{S}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\cdot\frac{S}{N}=\frac{1}{N}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t}),

and,

ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ¥Xiâˆ’ğ”¼â€‹[Xi|wt]âˆ¥2|wt]ğ”¼delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–ğ”¼delimited-[]conditionalsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\lVert X_{i}-\mathbb{E}[X_{i}|w_{t}]\rVert^{2}|w_{t}] =âˆ¥âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2â‹…ğ”¼â€‹[(1Sâ‹…ğŸ™{ğ•šâˆˆğ’®ğ•¥}âˆ’1N)2]=âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2â‹…Varâ€‹(1Sâ‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t})absentâ‹…superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptâ‹…1ğ‘†subscript1ğ•šsubscriptğ’®ğ•¥1ğ‘2â‹…superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2Varâ‹…1ğ‘†subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\displaystyle=\lVert\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\rVert^{2}\cdot\mathbb{E}\left[\left(\frac{1}{S}\cdot\mathbbm{1_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}}-\frac{1}{N}\right)^{2}\right]=\lVert\nabla f(w_{t})\rVert^{2}\cdot\text{Var}\left(\frac{1}{S}\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}\right)
=âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2S2â‹…SNâ€‹(1âˆ’SN)=âˆ¥âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2Sâ€‹Nâ€‹(1âˆ’SN),absentâ‹…superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2superscriptğ‘†2ğ‘†ğ‘1ğ‘†ğ‘superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2ğ‘†ğ‘1ğ‘†ğ‘\displaystyle=\frac{\lVert\nabla f(w_{t})\rVert^{2}}{S^{2}}\cdot\frac{S}{N}\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)=\frac{\lVert\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\rVert^{2}}{SN}\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\;,

where we used the fact that for any event ğ’œğ’œ\mathcal{A}, the following holds: Varâ€‹(ğŸ™ğ’œ)=â„™â€‹(ğ’œ)â‹…(1âˆ’â„™â€‹(ğ’œ))Varsubscript1ğ’œâ‹…â„™ğ’œ1â„™ğ’œ\text{Var}(\mathbbm{1}_{\mathcal{A}})=\mathbb{P}(\mathcal{A})\cdot(1-\mathbb{P}(\mathcal{A})). Therefore, using LemmaÂ C.3, we obtain that

ğ”¼â€‹[â€–âˆ‘i=1N(1Sâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â‹…ğŸ™{iâˆˆğ’®t})â€–2â€‹wt]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘â‹…1ğ‘†âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡subscript1ğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡2subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\left(\frac{1}{S}\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\cdot\mathbbm{1}_{\left\{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}\right\}}\right)}\right\|^{2}~{}\vrule~{}w_{t}\right] â‰¤2â€‹â€–1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â€–2+2Sâ€‹Nâ€‹(1âˆ’SN)â€‹âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ¥âˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)âˆ¥2absent2superscriptnorm1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡22ğ‘†ğ‘1ğ‘†ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq 2\left\|\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})}\right\|^{2}+\frac{2}{SN}\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\lVert\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})\rVert^{2}}
â‰¤2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+2Sâ€‹(1âˆ’SN)â€‹(G2+B2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2)absent2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡22ğ‘†1ğ‘†ğ‘superscriptğº2superscriptğµ2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq 2\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2}{S}\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\left(G^{2}+B^{2}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}\right)
=(1âˆ’SN)â€‹2â€‹G2S+2â€‹(1+(1âˆ’SN)â€‹B2S)âŸâ‰”Î³â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2,absent1ğ‘†ğ‘2superscriptğº2ğ‘†2subscriptâŸ11ğ‘†ğ‘superscriptğµ2ğ‘†â‰”absentğ›¾superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡2\displaystyle=\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\frac{2G^{2}}{S}+2\underbrace{\left(1+\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\frac{B^{2}}{S}\right)}_{\coloneqq\gamma}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}\;,

where in the second inequality we used the bounded gradient dissimilarity assumption (AssumptionÂ 3.2). Plugging back to Eq.Â (22), we get the following bound on (B)ğµ(B):

2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹â€–1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(wt)â€–2â‰¤(1âˆ’SN)â€‹4â€‹G2S+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2.2ğ”¼superscriptnorm1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡21ğ‘†ğ‘4superscriptğº2ğ‘†4ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡22\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}_{t}}{\nabla f_{i}(w_{t})}\right\|^{2}\leq\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\frac{4G^{2}}{S}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}\;.

Plugging the bounds on (A)ğ´(A) and (B)ğµ(B) in Eq.Â (20) finally gives

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^tâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{t}\rVert^{2} â‰¤Ïƒ2S+(1âˆ’SN)â€‹4â€‹G2SâŸ=Ïƒ~2/S+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î²2Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2absentsubscriptâŸsuperscriptğœ2ğ‘†1ğ‘†ğ‘4superscriptğº2ğ‘†absentsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†4ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡22superscriptğ›½2ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq\underbrace{\frac{\sigma^{2}}{S}+\left(1-\frac{S}{N}\right)\frac{4G^{2}}{S}}_{=\tilde{\sigma}^{2}/S}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2\beta^{2}}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}
=Ïƒ~S2+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î²2Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2,absentsubscriptsuperscript~ğœ2ğ‘†4ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¡22superscriptğ›½2ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle=\tilde{\sigma}^{2}_{S}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2\beta^{2}}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\;,

which concludes the proof. âˆ

The next result establishes a bound on the model estimation error of the clients.

Lemma C.2.

Consider the notations of TheoremÂ 1. Let Î±â‰”4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯,Ïâ‰”20â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯formulae-sequenceâ‰”ğ›¼4superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯â‰”ğœŒ20superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯\alpha\coloneqq 4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T},\rho\coloneqq 20\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}, and âˆ‡âˆ’â„“â‰”0,âˆ€â„“âˆˆâ„•formulae-sequenceâ‰”subscriptâˆ‡â„“0for-allâ„“â„•\nabla_{-\ell}\coloneqq 0,\enskip\forall\ell\in{\mathbb{N}}. Then, the following result holds:

1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2â‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥21ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}}\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}
Proof.

We use strong induction. Particularly, to prove the result holds at round tğ‘¡t, we rely on its correctness over the ğ’¯ğ’¯\mathcal{T} prior rounds, i.e., for every s=tâˆ’ğ’¯,â€¦,tâˆ’1ğ‘ ğ‘¡ğ’¯â€¦ğ‘¡1s=t-\mathcal{T},\ldots,t-1. Thus, in our base case, we show that the result holds up to round ğ’¯ğ’¯\mathcal{T}.
We start with some general observations that hold for any tğ‘¡t. Recall that w^ti=yti+ğ’â€‹(wtâˆ’yti)superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ’subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–\hat{w}_{t}^{i}=y_{t}^{i}+\mathcal{C}(w_{t}-y_{t}^{i}). From AssumptionÂ 3.3, we have

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2=ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ’câ€‹(wtâˆ’yti)âˆ’(wtâˆ’yti)âˆ¥2â‰¤Ï‰2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥wtâˆ’ytiâˆ¥2.ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ’ğ‘subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–2superscriptğœ”2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}=\mathbb{E}\lVert\mathcal{C}_{c}(w_{t}-y_{t}^{i})-(w_{t}-y_{t}^{i})\rVert^{2}\leq\omega^{2}\mathbb{E}\lVert w_{t}-y_{t}^{i}\rVert^{2}\;. (23)

Unrolling the update rule for wtsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡w_{t}, we have for all iâˆˆ[N]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘i\in\left[N\right] that

wt=wtâˆ’Ï„tiâˆ’Î·â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1g^k=ytiâˆ’Î·â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1g^k.subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜w_{t}=w_{t-\tau_{t}^{i}}-\eta\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{g}_{k}}=y_{t}^{i}-\eta\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{g}_{k}}\;.

Let g^âˆ’kâ‰”0â‰”subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜0\hat{g}_{-k}\coloneqq 0 for all kâˆˆâ„•ğ‘˜â„•k\in{\mathbb{N}}. Additionally, let Î¾^k=g^kâˆ’âˆ‡^ksubscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜\hat{\xi}_{k}=\hat{g}_{k}-\hat{\nabla}_{k} for all kğ‘˜k, where âˆ‡^k=ğ”¼â€‹[g^k]subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜ğ”¼delimited-[]subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜\hat{\nabla}_{k}=\mathbb{E}[\hat{g}_{k}], as defined in the proof of TheoremÂ 1. Plugging back to Eq.Â (23), we get that

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2} â‰¤Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1g^kâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1Î¾^kâˆ¥2,absentsuperscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜22superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜22superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{g}_{k}}\rVert^{2}\leq 2\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{\nabla}_{k}}\rVert^{2}+2\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{\xi}_{k}}\rVert^{2}\;, (24)

where the last inequality follows from âˆ¥a+bâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹âˆ¥aâˆ¥2+2â€‹âˆ¥bâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘2\lVert a+b\rVert^{2}\leq 2\lVert a\rVert^{2}+2\lVert b\rVert^{2}. Using LemmaÂ C.5, we can bound the first term in the right-hand side, as

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2â‰¤Ï„tiâ€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2,ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜2superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{\nabla}_{k}}\rVert^{2}\leq\tau_{t}^{i}\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\leq\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;,

where the last inequality follows from Ï„tiâ‰¤ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ’¯\tau_{t}^{i}\leq\mathcal{T}. Since ğ”¼â€‹[Î¾^k]=0ğ”¼delimited-[]subscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜0\mathbb{E}[\hat{\xi}_{k}]=0, and ğ”¼â€‹[Î¾^kâŠ¤â€‹Î¾^â„“]=0ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜topsubscript^ğœ‰â„“0\mathbb{E}[\hat{\xi}_{k}^{\top}\hat{\xi}_{\ell}]=0 for all k,â„“ğ‘˜â„“k,\ell, we can apply LemmaÂ C.4 to bound the second term in the right-hand side as follows:

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1Î¾^kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1subscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\hat{\xi}_{k}}\rVert^{2} =âˆ‘k=tâˆ’Ï„titâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥Î¾^kâˆ¥2â‰¤âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥Î¾^kâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2+2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2,absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğœ‰ğ‘˜22superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜22superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\displaystyle=\sum_{k=t-\tau_{t}^{i}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\xi}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\leq\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\xi}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\leq 2\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2}}+2\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;,

where we used Ï„tiâ‰¤ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ’¯\tau_{t}^{i}\leq\mathcal{T}, and âˆ¥aâˆ’bâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹âˆ¥aâˆ¥2+2â€‹âˆ¥bâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ‘2\lVert a-b\rVert^{2}\leq 2\lVert a\rVert^{2}+2\lVert b\rVert^{2}.

Plugging-in both bounds to Eq.Â (24), we obtain:

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2} â‰¤(2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2)â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2absent2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯4superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq(2\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2})\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}}
â‰¤6â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2.absent6superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq 6\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;. (25)

Note that we can bound ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2} as:

ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}\rVert^{2} â‰¤2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ’âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹Î²2Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^kiâˆ’wkâˆ¥2+2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2,absent2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22superscriptğ›½2ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘˜ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘˜22ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq 2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}-\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}+2\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{2\beta^{2}}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{k}^{i}-w_{k}\rVert^{2}}+2\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}\;,

where in the last inequality we used Eq.Â (C.1) to bound ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡^kâˆ’âˆ‡kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^âˆ‡ğ‘˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{\nabla}_{k}-\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}.

For the ease of notation, denote: etiâ‰”ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥w^tiâˆ’wtâˆ¥2â‰”superscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤ğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘¡2e_{t}^{i}\coloneqq\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{w}_{t}^{i}-w_{t}\rVert^{2}, and etâ‰”1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Netiâ‰”subscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–e_{t}\coloneqq\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{e_{t}^{i}}. Therefore, we obtain from Eq.Â (C.2) that

etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–\displaystyle e_{t}^{i} â‰¤12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ek+12â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2.absent12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜12superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\leq 12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{e_{k}}+12\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;. (26)

Base Case: For t=0ğ‘¡0t=0, each client obtains the exact model weights, i.e., w^0i=w0superscriptsubscript^ğ‘¤0ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¤0\hat{w}_{0}^{i}=w_{0}, which trivially implies result. For every t=1,â€¦,ğ’¯ğ‘¡1â€¦ğ’¯t=1,\ldots,\mathcal{T} and iâˆˆ[N]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘i\in\left[N\right], we have from Eq.Â (26) that

etiâ‰¤12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ek+12â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2.superscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜12superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2e_{t}^{i}\leq 12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{e_{k}}+12\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;. (27)

Using LemmaÂ C.1 to bound ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2}, we get:

etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–\displaystyle e_{t}^{i} â‰¤12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ek+12â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Ïƒ~S2+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î²2â€‹ek)absent12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜12superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†24ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22superscriptğ›½2subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq 12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{e_{k}}+12\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\left(\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}+2\beta^{2}e_{k}\right)}
â‰¤4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~S2+(12â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯+16â€‹Î³â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2)â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+(12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯+8â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2)â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ekabsent4superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†212superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯16ğ›¾superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜212superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯8superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq 4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\left(12\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}+16\gamma\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\right)\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\left(12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}+8\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\right)\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{e_{k}}
â‰¤4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹Ïƒ~S2+28â€‹Î³â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+20â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ek.absent4superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†228ğ›¾superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜220superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq 4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+28\gamma\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+20\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{e_{k}}\;.

Note that this bound on etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–e_{t}^{i} is independent of iğ‘–i, and thus, it holds for the average of etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–e_{t}^{i} over iâˆˆ[N]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘i\in\left[N\right], namely, etsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡e_{t}. Therefore, Eq.Â (26) implies a recursive bound on etsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡e_{t}; for every t=1,â€¦,ğ’¯ğ‘¡1â€¦ğ’¯t=1,\ldots,\mathcal{T}:

etâ‰¤Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ek,subscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœŒsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle e_{t}\leq\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{e_{k}}\;, (28)

where we denoted Î½â‰”28â€‹Î³â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â‰”ğœˆ28ğ›¾superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯\nu\coloneqq 28\gamma\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}. Plugging-in this bound instead of eksubscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜e_{k} in the right-hand side, we obtain:

etsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡\displaystyle e_{t} â‰¤Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1(Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1eâ„“)absentğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœŒsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2ğœŒsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘’â„“\displaystyle\leq\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\left(\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{e_{\ell}}\right)}
â‰¤Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ïâ€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ï2â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1eâ„“,absentğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœˆğœŒsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2superscriptğœŒ2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘’â„“\displaystyle\leq\alpha\left(1+\rho\mathcal{T}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\nu\rho\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}+\rho^{2}\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{e_{\ell}}}\;,

where we used tâ‰¤ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ’¯t\leq\mathcal{T}. Note that we can bound the double sums in right-hand side using LemmaÂ C.6 as

âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2â‰¤tâ€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2,superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\leq t\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}\leq\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;,

and similarly,

âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1eâ„“â‰¤ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ek.superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘’â„“ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{e_{\ell}}}\leq\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{e_{k}}\;.

Plugging-back, we get:

etâ‰¤Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ï2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ek.subscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœˆğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2superscriptğœŒ2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle e_{t}\leq\alpha\left(1+\rho\mathcal{T}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\nu\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{e_{k}}\;.

We can once again apply Eq.Â (28) to bound eksubscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜e_{k}, and obtain:

etâ‰¤subscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡absent\displaystyle e_{t}\leq Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ï2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2(Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1eâ„“)ğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœˆğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2superscriptğœŒ2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2ğœŒsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘’â„“\displaystyle\alpha\left(1+\rho\mathcal{T}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\nu\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\left(\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{e_{\ell}}\right)}
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+Ï2â€‹ğ’¯2)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ï2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ï3â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1eâ„“ğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptğœŒ2superscriptğ’¯2superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœˆğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2ğœˆsuperscriptğœŒ2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2superscriptğœŒ3ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘’â„“\displaystyle\alpha\left(1+\rho\mathcal{T}+\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}^{2}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\nu\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\nu\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}+\rho^{3}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{e_{\ell}}}
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+Ï2â€‹ğ’¯2)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’2ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Î½â€‹Ï2â€‹ğ’¯2â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’3ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2+Ï3â€‹ğ’¯2â€‹âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’3ek,ğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptğœŒ2superscriptğ’¯2superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœˆğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2ğœˆsuperscriptğœŒ2superscriptğ’¯2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡3ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2superscriptğœŒ3superscriptğ’¯2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡3subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle\alpha\left(1{+}\rho\mathcal{T}{+}\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}^{2}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}{+}\nu\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}{+}\nu\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=0}^{t-2}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}{+}\nu\rho^{2}\mathcal{T}^{2}\sum_{k=0}^{t-3}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}+\rho^{3}\mathcal{T}^{2}\sum_{k=0}^{t-3}{e_{k}}\;,

where in the last inequality we used LemmaÂ C.6. Repeating this process of alternately applying Eq.Â (28) to bound eksubscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜e_{k} and LemmaÂ C.6, finally gives:

etâ‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=0tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2.subscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle e_{t}\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{\nu}{\rho\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=0}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;.

Plugging Î½ğœˆ\nu and ÏğœŒ\rho, we can bound the coefficient Î½/Ïâ€‹ğ’¯ğœˆğœŒğ’¯\nu/\rho\mathcal{T} as:

Î½Ïâ€‹ğ’¯=28â€‹Î³â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯20â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯2â‰¤2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯.ğœˆğœŒğ’¯28ğ›¾superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯20superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ’¯22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯\displaystyle\frac{\nu}{\rho\mathcal{T}}=\frac{28\gamma\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}}{20\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}^{2}}\leq\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\;.

Using (Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ‰¤kâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)ksuperscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\leq k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}, which holds for any kâ‰¥1ğ‘˜1k\geq 1, we then obtain:

etsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡\displaystyle e_{t} â‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=0tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2.absentğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=0}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;.

Note that for all tâ‰¤ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ’¯t\leq\mathcal{T} and kâ‰¥1ğ‘˜1k\geq 1, we have tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯â‰¤0ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯0t-k\mathcal{T}\leq 0. Therefore, since for âˆ‡âˆ’â„“=0subscriptâˆ‡â„“0\nabla_{-\ell}=0 for all â„“âˆˆâ„•â„“â„•\ell\in{\mathbb{N}}, we can equivalently write:

etsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡\displaystyle e_{t} â‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2,absentğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;,

which establishes the result for the base case.

Induction step: The induction hypothesis is that the following holds:

esâ‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1skâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1s(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=sâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯sâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2,âˆ€s=tâˆ’ğ’¯,â€¦,tâˆ’1.formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘’ğ‘ ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘ ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘ superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2for-allğ‘ ğ‘¡ğ’¯â€¦ğ‘¡1e_{s}\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{s}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{s}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=s-k\mathcal{T}}^{s-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}},\quad\forall s=t-\mathcal{T},\ldots,t-1\;. (29)

We focus on Eq.Â (26). Using LemmaÂ C.1 to bound ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥g^kâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscript^ğ‘”ğ‘˜2\mathbb{E}\lVert\hat{g}_{k}\rVert^{2} and following similar steps to those used to derive Eq.Â (28), we get:

etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–\displaystyle e_{t}^{i} â‰¤12â€‹Î²2â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ek+12â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+4â€‹Ï‰2â€‹Î·2â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1(Ïƒ~S2+4â€‹Î³â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î²2â€‹ek)absent12superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜12superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜24superscriptğœ”2superscriptğœ‚2superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†24ğ›¾ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22superscriptğ›½2subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq 12\beta^{2}\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{e_{k}}+12\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+4\omega^{2}\eta^{2}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\left(\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+4\gamma\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}+2\beta^{2}e_{k}\right)}
â‰¤Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ekâŸ=(â€ ).absentğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœŒsubscriptâŸsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜absentâ€ \displaystyle\leq\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\underbrace{\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{e_{k}}}_{=({\dagger})}\;. (30)

From the induction hypothesisÂ (29), we can bound eksubscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜e_{k} for every kâˆˆ[tâˆ’ğ’¯,tâˆ’1]ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1k\in\left[t-\mathcal{T},t-1\right] as follows:

ekâ‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘â„“=1kâ„“â€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â„“)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘â„“=1k(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â„“â€‹âˆ‘m=kâˆ’â„“â€‹ğ’¯kâˆ’â„“ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡mâˆ¥2.subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ‘˜â„“superscriptğœŒğ’¯â„“superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯â„“superscriptsubscriptğ‘šğ‘˜â„“ğ’¯ğ‘˜â„“ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘š2e_{k}\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{\ell=1}^{k}{\ell(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\ell}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{\ell=1}^{k}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\ell}\sum_{m=k-\ell\mathcal{T}}^{k-\ell}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{m}\rVert^{2}}}\;.

Denote this bound by Bâ€‹(k)â‰”Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘â„“=1kâ„“â€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â„“)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘â„“=1k(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)â„“â€‹âˆ‘m=kâˆ’â„“â€‹ğ’¯kâˆ’â„“ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡mâˆ¥2â‰”ğµğ‘˜ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ‘˜â„“superscriptğœŒğ’¯â„“superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯â„“superscriptsubscriptğ‘šğ‘˜â„“ğ’¯ğ‘˜â„“ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘š2B(k)\coloneqq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{\ell=1}^{k}{\ell(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\ell}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{\ell=1}^{k}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{\ell}\sum_{m=k-\ell\mathcal{T}}^{k-\ell}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{m}\rVert^{2}}}; that is, ekâ‰¤Bâ€‹(k)subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜ğµğ‘˜e_{k}\leq B(k). We can therefore bound (â€ )â€ ({\dagger}) as

âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ekâ‰¤âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1Bâ€‹(k)â‰¤ğ’¯â€‹Bâ€‹(tâˆ’1),superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘’ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğµğ‘˜ğ’¯ğµğ‘¡1\displaystyle\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{e_{k}}\leq\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{B(k)}\leq\mathcal{T}B(t-1)\;,

where the last inequality holds because Bâ€‹(k)ğµğ‘˜B(k) is monotonically increasing. Plugging back to Eq.Â (C.2) and substituting Bâ€‹(tâˆ’1)ğµğ‘¡1B(t-1) gives

etiâ‰¤superscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–absent\displaystyle e_{t}^{i}\leq Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Ïâ‹…ğ’¯â€‹Bâ€‹(tâˆ’1)ğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2â‹…ğœŒğ’¯ğµğ‘¡1\displaystyle\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\rho\cdot\mathcal{T}B(t-1)
=\displaystyle= Î±â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹(Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1kâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’1âˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’1âˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2)ğ›¼superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2ğœŒğ’¯ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\alpha\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}{+}\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}{+}\rho\mathcal{T}\left(\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\sum_{\ell=t-1-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-1-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}\right)
=\displaystyle= Î±â€‹(1+Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1kâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k+1)âŸ=(A)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k+1â€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’1âˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’1âˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2âŸ=(B).subscriptâŸğ›¼1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜1absentğ´superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†2subscriptâŸğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2absentğµ\displaystyle\underbrace{\alpha\left(1{+}\rho\mathcal{T}{+}\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k+1}}\right)}_{=(A)}\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\underbrace{\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k+1}\sum_{\ell=t-1-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-1-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}}_{=(B)}\;. (31)

Bounding (A)ğ´(A):

Using simple algebra, we have that

Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1kâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k+1ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜1\displaystyle\rho\mathcal{T}+\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k+1}} =Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+âˆ‘k=2t(kâˆ’1)â€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ‰¤Ïâ€‹ğ’¯+âˆ‘k=2tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k=âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k.absentğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡ğ‘˜1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜\displaystyle=\rho\mathcal{T}+\sum_{k=2}^{t}{(k-1)(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\leq\rho\mathcal{T}+\sum_{k=2}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}=\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\;. (32)

This implies that (A)ğ´(A) is bounded by Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)ğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right).

Bounding (B)ğµ(B):

Focusing on the first term in (B)ğµ(B), we can bound:

Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2=Î½Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â‹…Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â‹…Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2.ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2â‹…ğœˆğœŒğ’¯ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2â‹…2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜2\displaystyle\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}=\frac{\nu}{\rho\mathcal{T}}\cdot\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}\leq\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\cdot\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}\;. (33)

Focusing on the second sum in (B)ğµ(B), we can bound

2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k+1â€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’1âˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’1âˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k+1}\sum_{\ell=t-1-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-1-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}} =2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=2t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’1âˆ’(kâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’1âˆ’(kâˆ’1)ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2absent2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜1ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle=\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=2}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-1-(k-1)\mathcal{T}}^{t-1-(k-1)}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}
=2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=2t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯+ğ’¯âˆ’1tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2absent2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ’¯1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle=\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=2}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}+\mathcal{T}-1}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}
â‰¤2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=2t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2,absent2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\leq\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=2}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;, (34)

where the last inequality holds since ğ’¯âˆ’1â‰¥0ğ’¯10\mathcal{T}-1\geq 0 and ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2â‰¥0ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“20\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}\geq 0 for all â„“â„“\ell. Combining the bounds in Eq.Â (33) and (C.2), we can then bound (B)ğµ(B) as

Î½â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1tâˆ’1(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k+1â€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’1âˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’1âˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2â‰¤ğœˆsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡1superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2absent\displaystyle\nu\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}{+}\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t-1}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k+1}\sum_{\ell=t-1-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-1-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\leq 2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â‹…Ïâ€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=tâˆ’ğ’¯tâˆ’1ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡kâˆ¥2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=2t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2â‹…2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯ğœŒğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ’¯ğ‘¡1ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘˜22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜2ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\cdot\rho\mathcal{T}\sum_{k=t-\mathcal{T}}^{t-1}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{k}\rVert^{2}}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=2}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}
=\displaystyle= 2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2.2ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;. (35)

Plugging back to Eq.Â (C.2) the bounds on (A)ğ´(A) and (B)ğµ(B) (from Eq.Â (32) and (C.2), respectively), we get:

etisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–\displaystyle e_{t}^{i} â‰¤Î±â€‹(1+âˆ‘k=1tkâ€‹(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)k)â€‹Ïƒ~S2+2â€‹Î³Î²2â€‹ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘k=1t(Ïâ€‹ğ’¯)kâ€‹âˆ‘â„“=tâˆ’kâ€‹ğ’¯tâˆ’kğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡â„“âˆ¥2.absentğ›¼1superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscript~ğœğ‘†22ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptğœŒğ’¯ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâ„“ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡â„“2\displaystyle\leq\alpha\left(1+\sum_{k=1}^{t}{k(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}}\right)\tilde{\sigma}_{S}^{2}+\frac{2\gamma}{\beta^{2}\mathcal{T}}\sum_{k=1}^{t}{(\rho\mathcal{T})^{k}\sum_{\ell=t-k\mathcal{T}}^{t-k}{\mathbb{E}\lVert\nabla_{\ell}\rVert^{2}}}\;.

Since this bound is independent of iğ‘–i, it also holds for the average et=1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Netisubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ‘–e_{t}=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{e_{t}^{i}}, establishing the result. âˆ

In the following two lemmas, we characterize the second moment of the sum of independent random variables.

Lemma C.3 (LemmaÂ 4, Karimireddy etÂ al., 2020).

Let X1,â€¦,XNâˆˆâ„dsubscriptğ‘‹1â€¦subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘superscriptâ„ğ‘‘X_{1},\ldots,X_{N}\in{\mathbb{R}}^{d} be Nğ‘N independent random variables. Suppose that ğ”¼â€‹[Xi]=Î¼iğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscriptğœ‡ğ‘–\mathbb{E}[X_{i}]=\mu_{i} and ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥Xiâˆ’Î¼iâˆ¥2â‰¤Ïƒi2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscriptğœ‡ğ‘–2superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–2\mathbb{E}\lVert X_{i}-\mu_{i}\rVert^{2}\leq\sigma_{i}^{2}. Then, the following holds

ğ”¼â€‹â€–âˆ‘i=1NXiâ€–2â‰¤2â€‹â€–âˆ‘i=1NÎ¼iâ€–2+2â€‹âˆ‘i=1NÏƒi2.ğ”¼superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–22superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğœ‡ğ‘–22superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–2\mathbb{E}\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{X_{i}}\right\|^{2}\leq 2\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mu_{i}}\right\|^{2}+2\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\sigma_{i}^{2}}\;.
Lemma C.4.

Let X1,â€¦,XNâˆˆâ„dsubscriptğ‘‹1â€¦subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘superscriptâ„ğ‘‘X_{1},\ldots,X_{N}\in{\mathbb{R}}^{d} be Nğ‘N orthogonal, zero mean random variables, i.e., ğ”¼â€‹[Xi]=0ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–0\mathbb{E}[X_{i}]=0 for all iâˆˆ[N]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘i\in\left[N\right], and ğ”¼â€‹[XiâŠ¤â€‹Xj]=0ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–topsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘—0\mathbb{E}[X_{i}^{\top}X_{j}]=0 for all iâ‰ jğ‘–ğ‘—i\neq j. Then, the following holds:

ğ”¼â€‹â€–âˆ‘i=1NXiâ€–2=âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥Xiâˆ¥2.ğ”¼superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N}{X_{i}}\right\|^{2}=\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert X_{i}\rVert^{2}}\;.
Proof.

By the linearity of expectation, and the following property: ğ”¼â€‹[XiâŠ¤â€‹Xj]=0,âˆ€iâ‰ jformulae-sequenceğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–topsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘—0for-allğ‘–ğ‘—\mathbb{E}[X_{i}^{\top}X_{j}]=0,\enskip\forall i\neq j, we immediately get that ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘i=1NXiâˆ¥2=ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ‘j=1NXiâŠ¤â€‹Xj]=âˆ‘i=1Nğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥Xiâˆ¥2ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–2ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–topsubscriptğ‘‹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘ğ”¼superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–2\mathbb{E}\lVert\sum_{i=1}^{N}{X_{i}}\rVert^{2}=\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\sum_{j=1}^{N}{X_{i}^{\top}X_{j}}}\right]=\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\mathbb{E}\lVert X_{i}\rVert^{2}}. âˆ

Next, we state a simple result about the squared norm of the sum of vectors.

Lemma C.5.

For any u1,â€¦,uNâˆˆâ„dsubscriptğ‘¢1â€¦subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘superscriptâ„ğ‘‘u_{1},\ldots,u_{N}\in{\mathbb{R}}^{d}, it holds that âˆ¥âˆ‘i=1Nuiâˆ¥2â‰¤Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ¥uiâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–2ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–2\lVert\sum_{i=1}^{N}{u_{i}}\rVert^{2}\leq N\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\lVert u_{i}\rVert^{2}}.

Proof.

By the convexity of âˆ¥â‹…âˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥â‹…2\lVert\cdot\rVert^{2} and Jensenâ€™s inequality: âˆ¥1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nuiâˆ¥2â‰¤1Nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1Nâˆ¥uiâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–21ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–2\lVert\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{u_{i}}\rVert^{2}{\leq}\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}{\lVert u_{i}\rVert^{2}}, which implies the result. âˆ

The next result is a simple bound on a double sum of non-negative numbers.

Lemma C.6.

Let t,Ï„âˆˆâ„•ğ‘¡ğœâ„•t,\tau\in{\mathbb{N}} such that tâ‰¥Ï„+1ğ‘¡ğœ1t\geq\tau+1. For any sequence of non-negative numbers x0,x1,â€¦,xtâˆ’Ï„âˆ’1subscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥1â€¦subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğœ1x_{0},x_{1},\ldots,x_{t-\tau-1}, the following holds

âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’Ï„âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1xâ„“â‰¤tâ‹…âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’Ï„âˆ’1xk.superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡ğœsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘¥â„“â‹…ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡ğœ1subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜\sum_{k=0}^{t-\tau}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{x_{\ell}}}\leq t\cdot\sum_{k=0}^{t-\tau-1}{x_{k}}\;.
Proof.

Immediately: âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’Ï„âˆ‘â„“=0kâˆ’1xâ„“=âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’Ï„âˆ’1(tâˆ’Ï„âˆ’k)â€‹xkâ‰¤tâ‹…âˆ‘k=0tâˆ’Ï„âˆ’1xksuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡ğœsuperscriptsubscriptâ„“0ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘¥â„“superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡ğœ1ğ‘¡ğœğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜â‹…ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡ğœ1subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜\sum_{k=0}^{t-\tau}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{x_{\ell}}}=\sum_{k=0}^{t-\tau-1}{(t-\tau-k)x_{k}}\leq t\cdot\sum_{k=0}^{t-\tau-1}{x_{k}}. âˆ

The following lemma gives a bound on the derivative of a power series.

Lemma C.7.

Let a<1ğ‘1a<1. Then,

âˆ‘k=1âˆkâ€‹ak=a(1âˆ’a)2.superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘superscript1ğ‘2\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{ka^{k}}=\frac{a}{(1-a)^{2}}\;.
Proof.

Let fkâ€‹(a)=aksubscriptğ‘“ğ‘˜ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘˜f_{k}(a)=a^{k}.

âˆ‘k=1âˆkâ€‹ak=aâ€‹âˆ‘k=1âˆkâ€‹akâˆ’1=aâ€‹âˆ‘k=1âˆfkâ€²â€‹(a).superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘˜ğ‘\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{ka^{k}}=a\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{ka^{k-1}}=a\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{f^{\prime}_{k}(a)}\;.

Using term-by-term differentiationÂ (Stewart, 2015), we have that

âˆ‘k=1âˆfkâ€²â€‹(a)=(âˆ‘k=1âˆfkâ€‹(a))â€²=(âˆ‘k=1âˆak)â€²=(a1âˆ’a)â€²=1(1âˆ’a)2.superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘˜ğ‘superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘“ğ‘˜ğ‘â€²superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘ğ‘˜â€²superscriptğ‘1ğ‘â€²1superscript1ğ‘2\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{f^{\prime}_{k}(a)}=\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{f_{k}(a)}\right)^{\prime}=\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{a^{k}}\right)^{\prime}=\left(\frac{a}{1-a}\right)^{\prime}=\frac{1}{(1-a)^{2}}\;.

Multiplying by ağ‘a gives the result. âˆ

Next, we state a non-trivial inequality to bound the double sum that appears on the right-hand side of Eq.Â (17).

Lemma C.8.

Let aâˆˆ(0,1)ğ‘01a\in(0,1) and T,ğ’¯âˆˆâ„•ğ‘‡ğ’¯â„•T,\mathcal{T}\in{\mathbb{N}}. Moreover, let x0,â€¦,xTâˆ’1subscriptğ‘¥0â€¦subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘‡1x_{0},\ldots,x_{T-1} be a sequence of non-negative numbers. Then,

âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1aâŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹xkâ‰¤ğ’¯â€‹a1âˆ’aâ€‹âˆ‘k=0Tâˆ’1xk.superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ’¯ğ‘1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘‡1subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜\sum_{t=1}^{T}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{a^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}x_{k}}}\leq\mathcal{T}\frac{a}{1-a}\sum_{k=0}^{T-1}{x_{k}}\;.
Proof.

We start with changing the order of summation in the left-hand side. Note that for any fixed kğ‘˜k, the element xksubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x_{k} appears in the inner sum if kâ‰¤tâˆ’1ğ‘˜ğ‘¡1k\leq t-1, or equivalently, tâ‰¥k+1ğ‘¡ğ‘˜1t\geq k+1. Therefore,

âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ‘k=0tâˆ’1aâŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹xksuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}{\sum_{k=0}^{t-1}{a^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}x_{k}}} =âˆ‘k=0Tâˆ’1(âˆ‘t=k+1TaâŒˆtâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰)â€‹xk=âˆ‘k=0Tâˆ’1(âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ’kaâŒˆtğ’¯âŒ‰)â€‹xk.absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘‡1superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘˜1ğ‘‡superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘˜ğ’¯subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘‡1superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ’¯subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜\displaystyle=\sum_{k=0}^{T-1}{\left(\sum_{t=k+1}^{T}{a^{\lceil\frac{t-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}}\right)x_{k}}=\sum_{k=0}^{T-1}{\left(\sum_{t=1}^{T-k}{a^{\lceil\frac{t}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}}\right)x_{k}}\;. (36)

Focusing on the inner sum in the right-hand side, âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ’kaâŒˆt/ğ’¯âŒ‰superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ’¯\sum_{t=1}^{T-k}{a^{\lceil t/\mathcal{T}\rceil}}, we can divide the interval of integers from 111 to Tâˆ’kğ‘‡ğ‘˜T-k into non-overlapping intervals of length ğ’¯ğ’¯\mathcal{T} (and possibly a small residual) and get that

âˆ‘t=1Tâˆ’kaâŒˆtğ’¯âŒ‰â‰¤âˆ‘m=1âŒˆTâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰âˆ‘â„“=1ğ’¯aâŒˆ(mâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’¯+â„“ğ’¯âŒ‰â€‹=(â€ )â€‹âˆ‘m=1âŒˆTâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰âˆ‘â„“=1ğ’¯am=ğ’¯â€‹âˆ‘m=1âŒˆTâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰amâ‰¤ğ’¯â€‹a1âˆ’a.superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜superscriptğ‘ğ‘¡ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘š1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ’¯superscriptğ‘ğ‘š1ğ’¯â„“ğ’¯â€ superscriptsubscriptğ‘š1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜ğ’¯superscriptsubscriptâ„“1ğ’¯superscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ’¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘š1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜ğ’¯superscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ’¯ğ‘1ğ‘\sum_{t=1}^{T-k}{a^{\lceil\frac{t}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}}\leq\sum_{m=1}^{\lceil\frac{T-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}{\sum_{\ell=1}^{\mathcal{T}}{a^{\lceil\frac{(m-1)\mathcal{T}+\ell}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}}}\overset{({\dagger})}{=}\sum_{m=1}^{\lceil\frac{T-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}{\sum_{\ell=1}^{\mathcal{T}}{a^{m}}}=\mathcal{T}\sum_{m=1}^{\lceil\frac{T-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}{a^{m}}\leq\mathcal{T}\frac{a}{1-a}\;.

where (â€ )â€ ({\dagger}) holds because for every â„“=1,â€¦,ğ’¯â„“1â€¦ğ’¯\ell=1,\ldots,\mathcal{T} we have âŒˆ(mâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’¯+â„“ğ’¯âŒ‰=mğ‘š1ğ’¯â„“ğ’¯ğ‘š\lceil\frac{(m-1)\mathcal{T}+\ell}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil=m, and the last inequality follows from âˆ‘m=1âŒˆTâˆ’kğ’¯âŒ‰amâ‰¤âˆ‘m=1âˆam=a1âˆ’asuperscriptsubscriptğ‘š1ğ‘‡ğ‘˜ğ’¯superscriptğ‘ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘š1superscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘1ğ‘\sum_{m=1}^{\lceil\frac{T-k}{\mathcal{T}}\rceil}{a^{m}}\leq\sum_{m=1}^{\infty}{a^{m}}=\frac{a}{1-a} as a<1ğ‘1a<1. Plugging back to Eq.Â (36) concludes the proof. âˆ

The next lemma establishes that for small enough Î·ğœ‚\eta, we have âˆ’Î·/2+ğ’ªâ€‹(Î·2)â‰¤âˆ’Î·/4ğœ‚2ğ’ªsuperscriptğœ‚2ğœ‚4-\eta/2+\mathcal{O}(\eta^{2})\leq-\eta/4.

Lemma C.9.

Let Î³,Î¸â‰¥1ğ›¾ğœƒ1\gamma,\theta\geq 1. For every Î·â‰¤130â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸ğœ‚130ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒ\eta\leq\frac{1}{30\gamma\beta\theta}, it holds that

âˆ’Î·2+2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+160â€‹Î³â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2â€‹Î·3â‰¤âˆ’Î·4.ğœ‚22ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2160ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2superscriptğœ‚3ğœ‚4-\frac{\eta}{2}+2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+160\gamma\beta^{2}\theta^{2}\eta^{3}\leq-\frac{\eta}{4}\;.
Proof.

We equivalently prove that

2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+160â€‹Î³â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2â€‹Î·3â‰¤Î·4.2ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2160ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2superscriptğœ‚3ğœ‚42\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+160\gamma\beta^{2}\theta^{2}\eta^{3}\leq\frac{\eta}{4}\;.

Since both Î³â‰¥1ğ›¾1\gamma\geq 1 and Î¸â‰¥1ğœƒ1\theta\geq 1, we have

2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î·2+160â€‹Î³â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2â€‹Î·32ğ›¾ğ›½superscriptğœ‚2160ğ›¾superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2superscriptğœ‚3\displaystyle 2\gamma\beta\eta^{2}+160\gamma\beta^{2}\theta^{2}\eta^{3} â‰¤2â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸â€‹Î·2+160â€‹Î³2â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2â€‹Î·3absent2ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒsuperscriptğœ‚2160superscriptğ›¾2superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2superscriptğœ‚3\displaystyle\leq 2\gamma\beta\theta\eta^{2}+160\gamma^{2}\beta^{2}\theta^{2}\eta^{3}
=Î·4â€‹(8â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸â€‹Î·+640â€‹Î³2â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2â€‹Î·2)absentğœ‚48ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒğœ‚640superscriptğ›¾2superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2superscriptğœ‚2\displaystyle=\frac{\eta}{4}\left(8\gamma\beta\theta\eta+640\gamma^{2}\beta^{2}\theta^{2}\eta^{2}\right)
â‰¤Î·4â€‹(8â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸30â€‹Î³â€‹Î²â€‹Î¸+640â€‹Î³2â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2900â€‹Î³2â€‹Î²2â€‹Î¸2)=Î·4â‹…4445â‰¤Î·4,absentğœ‚48ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒ30ğ›¾ğ›½ğœƒ640superscriptğ›¾2superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2900superscriptğ›¾2superscriptğ›½2superscriptğœƒ2â‹…ğœ‚44445ğœ‚4\displaystyle\leq\frac{\eta}{4}\left(\frac{8\gamma\beta\theta}{30\gamma\beta\theta}+\frac{640\gamma^{2}\beta^{2}\theta^{2}}{900\gamma^{2}\beta^{2}\theta^{2}}\right)=\frac{\eta}{4}\cdot\frac{44}{45}\leq\frac{\eta}{4}\;,

where the second inequality follows from the upper bound on Î·ğœ‚\eta. âˆ

We also make use of the following result, which we prove using simple algebra.

Lemma C.10.

Suppose Î·=minâ¡{Î·1,Î·2,Î·3}ğœ‚subscriptğœ‚1subscriptğœ‚2subscriptğœ‚3\eta=\min\left\{\eta_{1},\eta_{2},\eta_{3}\right\} for some Î·1,Î·2,Î·3>0subscriptğœ‚1subscriptğœ‚2subscriptğœ‚30\eta_{1},\eta_{2},\eta_{3}>0, and let A,B,C>0ğ´ğµğ¶0A,B,C>0. Then, the following holds:

AÎ·+Bâ€‹Î·+Câ€‹Î·2â‰¤Aâ€‹(1Î·1+1Î·2+1Î·3)+Bâ€‹Î·2+Câ€‹Î·32.ğ´ğœ‚ğµğœ‚ğ¶superscriptğœ‚2ğ´1subscriptğœ‚11subscriptğœ‚21subscriptğœ‚3ğµsubscriptğœ‚2ğ¶superscriptsubscriptğœ‚32\displaystyle\frac{A}{\eta}+B\eta+C\eta^{2}\leq A\left(\frac{1}{\eta_{1}}+\frac{1}{\eta_{2}}+\frac{1}{\eta_{3}}\right)+B\eta_{2}+C\eta_{3}^{2}\;.
Proof.

Since Î·ğœ‚\eta is the minimum of three terms, 1/Î·1ğœ‚1/\eta is the maximum of their inverses. Thus, we can bound 1/Î·1ğœ‚1/\eta by the sum of the inverses as follows:

AÎ·=Aâ€‹maxâ¡{1Î·1,1Î·2,1Î·3}â‰¤Aâ€‹(1Î·1+1Î·2+1Î·3).ğ´ğœ‚ğ´1subscriptğœ‚11subscriptğœ‚21subscriptğœ‚3ğ´1subscriptğœ‚11subscriptğœ‚21subscriptğœ‚3\displaystyle\frac{A}{\eta}=A\max\left\{\frac{1}{\eta_{1}},\frac{1}{\eta_{2}},\frac{1}{\eta_{3}}\right\}\leq A\left(\frac{1}{\eta_{1}}+\frac{1}{\eta_{2}}+\frac{1}{\eta_{3}}\right)\;.

The terms Bâ€‹Î·ğµğœ‚B\eta and Câ€‹Î·2ğ¶superscriptğœ‚2C\eta^{2} are monotonically increasing with Î·ğœ‚\eta. We can therefore bound Î·ğœ‚\eta by Î·2subscriptğœ‚2\eta_{2} and Î·2superscriptğœ‚2\eta^{2} by Î·32superscriptsubscriptğœ‚32\eta_{3}^{2}. âˆ

Appendix D Entropy-Constrained Uniform Quantization

In this section, we describe a new compression technique entitled Entropy-Constrained Uniform Quantization (ECUQ), which we developed for anchor compression, although it can be of independent interest. ECUQ is described in AlgorithmÂ 4.

Let x=(xâ€‹(1),â€¦,xâ€‹(d))âˆˆâ„dğ‘¥ğ‘¥1â€¦ğ‘¥ğ‘‘superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x=\left(x(1),\ldots,x(d)\right)\in{\mathbb{R}}^{d} be some input vector we wish to compress using ECUQ. Denote: xminâ‰”miniâ¡xâ€‹(i)â‰”subscriptğ‘¥subscriptğ‘–ğ‘¥ğ‘–x_{\min}\coloneqq\min_{i}{x(i)}, xmaxâ‰”maxiâ¡xâ€‹(i)â‰”subscriptğ‘¥subscriptğ‘–ğ‘¥ğ‘–x_{\max}\coloneqq\max_{i}{x(i)}. Given some bandwidth budget of bğ‘b bits/coordinate, ECUQ initially divided the interval [xmin,xmax]subscriptğ‘¥subscriptğ‘¥\left[x_{\min},x_{\max}\right] into K=2bğ¾superscript2ğ‘K=2^{b} non-overlapping bins of equal size Î”=(xmaxâˆ’xmin)/KÎ”subscriptğ‘¥subscriptğ‘¥ğ¾\Delta=(x_{\max}-x_{\min})/K. Then, it sets the quantization values, which we denote by ğ’¬ğ’¬\mathcal{Q}, to be the centers of these bins. Afterwards, the vector xğ‘¥x is quantized into elements of ğ’¬ğ’¬\mathcal{Q}, that is, each element xâ€‹(i)ğ‘¥ğ‘–x(i) is assigned to its closest quantization value qâˆˆğ’¬ğ‘ğ’¬q\in\mathcal{Q} to generate the quantized vector x^ğ’¬subscript^ğ‘¥ğ’¬\hat{x}_{\mathcal{Q}}, whose elements are all in ğ’¬ğ’¬\mathcal{Q}. We then compute the empirical distribution of the quantized vector by counting for every qâˆˆğ’¬ğ‘ğ’¬q\in\mathcal{Q} the number of times it appears in x^ğ’¬subscript^ğ‘¥ğ’¬\hat{x}_{\mathcal{Q}}, and the entropy of the resulting distribution. Note that the entropy is upper bounded by logâ¡K=bğ¾ğ‘\log{K}=b. Finally, for some small tolerance parameter Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilon (we use Ïµ=0.1italic-Ïµ0.1\epsilon=0.1), we check whether the entropy is within Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilon distance from the budget bğ‘b: if it is not the case, then we perform a double binary search, repeating the above procedure with increased number of quantization values Kğ¾K, to find the maximal number of uniformly spaced quantization values such that the entropy of the empirical distribution of the resulting quantized vector is within Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilon distance from bğ‘b. Only after this entropy condition is satisfied, we encode x^ğ’¬subscript^ğ‘¥ğ’¬\hat{x}_{\mathcal{Q}} using some entropy encoding (we use Huffman coding).

FigureÂ 5 illustrates ECUQâ€™s encoder, as described in the text above. The corresponding decoder is fairly simple as it only performs entropy decoding in linear time (Huffman decoding).

While devising ECUQ, we also considered an additional method to approximate ECQ. It is similar to ECUQ, but instead of using uniformly spaced quantization values, it uses K-Means clustering to find the quantization values that minimize the overall squared error. We used a double binary search to find the largest number of levels Kğ¾K such that, after entropy encoding, the bandwidth constraint is satisfied. We termed this method Entropy-Constrained K-Means (ECK-Means).

We compare the performance of ECUQ with ECQ and ECK-Means in terms of their NMSE, and we also measure their encoding time. As we mentioned in the SectionÂ 4, ECQ is sensitive to hyperparameters; thus, we implemented it using a grid search over its hyperparameters to guarantee near-optimal performance.666While such implementation may increase the encoding time, we are not aware of any other approach to guarantee an optimal performance. ECQ aims at solving a hard non-convex problem, and different hyperparameters may result in different local minima. We evaluate the three methods on vectors drawn from three different synthetic distributions: (1) LogNormal(0,1)01(0,1); (2) Normal(0,1)01(0,1); and (3) Normal(1,0.1)10.1(1,0.1). In FigureÂ 6 (top) we show the NMSE and encoding time for different sizes of input vectors when the budget constraint is b=2ğ‘2b=2 bits/coordinate. As a complementary result, in FigureÂ 6 (bottom) we fix the dimension of the input vectors to d=212=4096ğ‘‘superscript2124096d=2^{12}=4096 and vary the bandwidth budget constraint from 222 to 555 bits/coordinate. The results imply that ECUQ exhibits a good speed-accuracy trade-off: it consistently outperforms ECK-Means while being an order of magnitude faster, and it is competitive with ECQ but about three orders of magnitude faster. Note additionally that it takes â‰ˆ20absent20\approx 20 minutes for ECQ to encode even a small vectors of size 212superscript2122^{12} with budget constraint of 444 bits/coordinate; this means that ECQ without some acceleration is not suitable for compressing neural networks with millions and even billions of parameters.

Appendix E Additional ECUQ Evaluations

Since ECUQ is a quantization-based method, in SectionÂ 4 and AppendixÂ D we compare it with quantization-based techniques. In FigureÂ 7, we give a complementary result comparing it with sparsification methods (Rand-K, Top-K) and sketching (Count-Sketch), where similar trends are observed. Note, however, that such techniques are mostly orthogonal to quantization-based methods and they can be used in conjunction.

Appendix F Experimental Details

We implemented DoCoFL in PyTorchÂ (Paszke etÂ al., 2019). In all experiments, the PS uses Momentum SGD as optimizer with a momentum of 0.90.90.9 and L2subscriptğ¿2L_{2} regularization (i.e., weight decay) with parameter 10âˆ’5superscript10510^{-5}. The clients, on the other hand, use vanilla SGD for all tasks but Amazon Reviews, for which Adam provided better results. InÂ TableÂ 4 we report the hyperparameters used in our experiments. To ease the computational burden and long training times, in the Shakespeare task we reduced the amount of train and validation data for each speaker (i.e., client) by a factor of 101010 by using only the first 10%percent1010\% of train and validation data, but no less than 222 samples per speaker.

Appendix G Additional Results

In this section we present additional results that were deferred from the main text.

G.1 Learning Curves
